result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Daniel Young was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: No violent or abusive contact with JHY.

Comply with all treatment recommendations from current health providers for mental health.
Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections.
0 days credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Daniel Young

records.addlTxt: 09:05 AM Defendant Joseph Daniel Young in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA Hatch: guilty to charge; probation w/ mental health assessment, no violent or abusive contact with JHY, court costs ($543), DNA. Defense free to argue sentence. Atty Nelson and Defendant agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Def pleas guilty to charge. Counsel stipulates to factual basis.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily and waives constitutional rights. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea. Court finds Defendant guilty to charge. DA Hatch argues for probation sentence. Atty Nelson argues for cost conly resolution.  Court orders S/W 1 year probation; court costs ($443). no violent or abusive contact with JHY, DNA sample within 30 days, Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections, comply with all treatment recommendations from current health providers for mental health. Defendant to report to probation today. 0 days credit.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Status conference on June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on April 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant must report to the Pierce County Day Report Center today for fingerprints and photograph.
NO ABUSIVE OR VIOLENT CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH J.H.Y.
Not to possess controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.

9:50 AM Defendant Joseph Daniel Young appears in Court, Atty Jens Hubert Loberg.  Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. NG. ADA Walker is requesting a $1,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of AS. Not to Possess and NAC J.H.Y, no objection. Court so orders. Court adjourned at 9:52 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
